alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:37PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Union, northern Marshall, Tippah, Benton, western Alcorn, southern Fayette and southern Hardeman Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 536 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Red Banks to near Gravestown to 6 miles east of Keownville. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Ripley, Lamar, Somerville, Blue Mountain, Snow Lake Shores, Mt Pleasant, Keownville, Theo, Michigan City, Red Banks, Canaan, Lagrange, Gravestown, Slayden, Marianna, Warren, Macon, Oakland and Piperton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
